unnormalised: Understanding CrPC Section 144 is crucial. It empowers a District Magistrate, Sub-divisional Magistrate, or any other executive magistrate specially empowered by the State Government to issue orders to prevent disruption of peace. For example, during the Ayodhya verdict in 2019, Sec. 144 was imposed in several cities. Violation can lead to arrest under IPC Section 188. Courts have debated its validity, balancing public order with fundamental rights under Article 19.
normalised: Understanding C-R-P-C Section one hundred and forty four is crucial. It empowers a District Magistrate, Sub-divisional Magistrate, or any other executive magistrate specially empowered by the State Government to issue orders to prevent disruption of peace. For example, during the Ayodhya verdict in two thousand and nineteen, Sec. one hundred and forty four was imposed in several cities. Violation can lead to arrest under I-P-C Section one hundred and eighty eight. Courts have debated its validity, balancing public order with fundamental rights under Article nineteen.
